chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
G: AbelianGroup
n: nat
m: nat

Goal:
forall A B C : matrix m n, Mplus A (Mplus B C) = Mplus (Mplus A B) C

Premises:
matrix = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) => Tn m (Tn n T) : Type -> nat -> nat -> Type Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
C = fun n p : nat => INR (fact n) / (INR (fact p) * INR (fact (n - p))) : nat -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Mplus = fun A B : matrix m n => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => plus (coeff_mat zero A i j) (coeff_mat zero B i j)) : matrix m n -> matrix m n -> matrix m n
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally
Mplus_comm : forall A B : matrix m n, Mplus A B = Mplus B A
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B For pair: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For pair: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Mopp = fun A : matrix m n => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => opp (coeff_mat zero A i j)) : matrix m n -> matrix m n
Inductive sumbool (A B : Prop) : Set := left : A -> {A} + {B} | right : B -> {A} + {B} For left, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For left, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument A is implicit For right, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For right, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument B is implicit For sumbool: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For left: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _] For right: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A For nil: Arguments are renamed to T For cons: Arguments are renamed to T, x, s For nil: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For cons: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For list: Argument scope is [type_scope] For nil: Argument scope is [type_scope] For cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
mk_matrix_bij : forall (x0 : ?T) (A : matrix ?m ?n), mk_matrix ?m ?n (coeff_mat x0 A) = A where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) (x0 : T) (A : matrix m n) (i j : nat) => coeff_Tn x0 (coeff_Tn (mk_Tn n (fun _ : nat => x0)) A i) j : forall (T : Type) (m n : nat), T -> matrix m n -> nat -> nat -> T Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P Datatypes.nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
sumbool_ind : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
Ring_polynom.PEc : forall C : Type, C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.PEsub : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.PEadd : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
Inductive PExpr (C : Type) : Type := PEO : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEI : Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEc : C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEX : positive -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEadd : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEsub : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEmul : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEopp : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C | PEpow : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> N -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C For PEO: Argument C is implicit and maximally inserted For PEI: Argument C is implicit and maximally inserted For PEc: Argument C is implicit For PEadd: Argument C is implicit For PEsub: Argument C is implicit For P...
Mzero = mk_matrix m n (fun _ _ : nat => zero) : matrix m n
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C For Pc: Argument C is implicit For Pinj: Argument C is implicit For PX: Argument C is implicit For Pol: Argument scope is [type_scope] For Pc: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For Pinj: Argument scopes are [type_scope positive_scope _] For PX: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ positive_scope _]
mk_matrix : forall m0 n0 : nat, (nat -> nat -> ?T) -> matrix m0 n0 where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type]
coeff_mat_ext : forall (x0 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, coeff_mat x0 v1 i j = coeff_mat x0 v2 i j) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat_ext_aux : forall (x1 x2 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, (i < ?m)%nat -> (j < ?n)%nat -> coeff_mat x1 v1 i j = coeff_mat x2 v2 i j) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, plus x zero = x where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
minus_eq_zero : forall x : ?G, minus x x = zero where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
mult_zero_r : forall x : ?K, mult x zero = zero where ?K : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Ring]
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
minus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, minus x zero = x where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]

```coq
intros A B C.
unfold Mplus.
assert (forall i j : nat, coeff_mat zero (Mplus A (Mplus B C)) i j = coeff_mat zero (Mplus (Mplus A B) C) i j).
- intros i j.
  rewrite!coeff_mat_ext with (x0 := zero) (v1 := Mplus A (Mplus B C)) (v2 := Mplus (Mplus A B) C).
  + reflexivity.
  + apply Mplus_comm.
  + apply Mplus_comm.
- apply mk_matrix_bij.
  apply H.
Qed.

original: intros A B C. unfold Mplus. assert (forall i j : nat, coeff_mat zero (Mplus A (Mplus B C)) i j = coeff_mat zero (Mplus (Mplus A B) C) i j). - intros i j.
